chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: It is very important to learn the concept of inline and block elements in HTML

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: Inline elements are those which take only the required width

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: Block elements are those which take the entire width of the screen

chunks.title: Inline & Block Elements in HTML
chunks.text: This is also called display property which can be set through CSS

text: It is very important to learn the concept of inline and block elements in HTML Inline elements are those which take only the required width Block elements are those which take the entire width of the screen This is also called display property which can be set through CSS If you are enjoying this video, then do like this video So let's go to the computer screen and see inline and block elements closely Through some very good examples Let's roll the intro So guys, it's time to see inline and block elements If you haven't accessed the playlist and code, then do both Because as the videos are being made, the code of the videos is being added to the playlist Now what I will do here is that I will make a folder called video8 I have already added 7 videos here I will make a video8 and open it in VS Code After opening VS Code, I will make an index.html and tell you about index and block elements I have entered with an exclamation mark and I could have typed this But I won't because I can't type this I will write inline and block elements here I have told you a little bit about this But I will tell you in detail about inline elements and why I want to use them Inline elements are those which take only the required width Don't block elements take the required width? No, they say that we need the full width Some people are like that, they just spread and spread I will tell you the difference And to explain this difference, I will cheat a little bit And the cheating is that I will add CSS You might think that I haven't studied CSS, why am I adding CSS? I am adding CSS as much as it is necessary And here I will just do one thing I will write P here I will enter and write here Let us say, hey, I am a para And I will tell here to give background color to P Let us say blue I will give a nice color here You can choose a good color Now you can see here I have given a color to paragraph And along with that I will add an anchor tag href is equal to Google.com let us say I will have to add HTTPS Then it will go to Google.com And I will write Google And the anchor tag I will give background color red But not red, I will do hover And this way I can choose any color in the spectrum How did you like Ninja Tagging? Let me know in the comment section below If you already knew about Ninja Tagging, then comment I am already a ninja So comment here This is very important I have given anchor tag to background color And I have made it similar Let me change it to reddish I have changed it to red orange And this is blue Now you can see the difference I will click here And as I click here, you can see This background color is found in width But this is found only in the element Why did this happen? This is because this is paragraph block element And our anchor tag is inline element Inline elements take only the same space Block elements take the same width And the next content comes below them When we take the width, the next content will come below them Along with that If I talk about div What is that? I am a block element And span is Which is like div But it is an inline element I am span and I am inline And after this If I put an anchor tag And write yes he is inline Then what happened? Let me show you the code If I write it in a new line Let me tell you how many spaces I can give This will not be added in my content Because HTML has more than one space And it doesn't include it If you want to give spaces You can write ampersand nbsp I will tell you about that But now I want to show you How this works So what happened? I wrote I am a paragraph And the next content will come below them I wrote ahrf is equal to this So it took only the width But the next content Was saying that I need the width So it will not come here It will come in the next line Because it says I need the width So it will come in the next line Google is also taking width So it will take the width If I give it a background color It will be visible in the width Let me give it a background color Let me give it a background color Yellow It took the width Along with that, I can keep the span And anchor tag in one line Because it is an inline element So it takes the same width as inline element And it gives the chance To give more elements in its own width Like you saw here This span gave the chance to anchor tag Will the anchor tag always be inline? Will the paragraph always be blocked? Will this always be there? The answer is no You can change it You can set the display property Of any element from CSS And if you set the display property It is not necessary that it will be inline It can also be blocked And the block element will be blocked It can also be inline We'll see this in CSS I want to pinpoint something The forms video was video 7 But I have put it in the video 6 folder So I'll call it video 7 What we are doing now is video 8 And there is nothing in video 7 So I'll quickly structure it Don't worry about that I hope you are getting good learnings Many people pointed this in the comments I'll fix it But I think that doesn't affect us Because you are getting it And the source code folder You'll get it right Along with that, go to codewitharri.com Click on notes and download notes And it will become a complimentary source I'm explaining everything step by step So don't worry about that So this was our inline and block elements Which elements are inline And which blocks are inline How the most commonly used elements Like div is the most used Then there is paragraph And you'll get some elements which are not used Maybe you don't know about them But you'll know about them in the
